definition: Guy de Maupassant (1850-1893), French novelist and short story writer

sentences.english: 《The String's Tale》 is a short story of Guy De Maupassant -a great master of French novel.
sentences.chinese: 《绳子的故事》是莫泊桑的一个短篇小说。

sentences.english: The great peculiarity in the work of Maupassant which strikes any reader immediately, is his conciseness.
sentences.chinese: 莫泊桑的作品之所以能迅速打动人是因为它的简洁。

sentences.english: I didn’t know them from Maupassant.
sentences.chinese: 莫泊桑之后的作家我都不了解。

sentences.english: Maupassant 's novel in translation, Chopin take his model.
sentences.chinese: 莫泊桑的小说翻译，肖邦他的模型。

sentences.english: I see no moral in Maupassant's 'The Necklace'.
sentences.chinese: 我看不出莫泊桑的《项链》有什么道德上的教育意义。

Anton Pavlovich Chekhov (1860-1904), Russian writer famous for his short stories and plays

Maugham (family name)/W. Somerset Maugham (1874-1965), English writer

definition: Prosper Mérimée (1803-1870), French scholar and writer, author of novel Carmen on which Bizet based his opera
Mark Twain (Samuel Langhorne Clemens 1835-1910), US writer, novelist and humorist, author of Adventures of Huckleberry Finn 哈克貝利·芬歷險記|哈克贝利·芬历险记[Ha1 ke4 bei4 li4 · Fen1 Li4 xian3 Ji4]
William Faulkner (1897-1962), American novelist and poet
